comments:
While declaring an attribute read-only (no set method is expected to be
generated), using the Ecore parameter (isChangeable=False), the following
Exception was encountered during deserialization:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The feature 'serverType' is not a valid
changeable feature
      at 
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.BasicEObjectImpl.eDynamicSet(BasicEObjectImpl.java:515)
      at
com.ibm.db.models.db2.luw.impl.LUWGenericServerImpl.eSet(LUWGenericServerImpl.java:281)
      at
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLHelperImpl.setValue(XMLHelperImpl.java:768)
[...]

We need to be able to generate code through EMF for read-only attributes
(isChangeable=False) that are not expected to have any set<AttribName>() method
being generated. That should not have an impact on being able to deserialize the
object (i.e. while default isTransient=False). Otherwise it forces EMF clients
to implement a custom serialization. This expectation is similar to default JDK
serialization/deserialization which does happen consistently even from read-only
attributes. The usage of a private attribute proposed through the forum does not
fit our needs as we need to have an accessor for this attribute, but no modifier.

The implementation described in the bugzilla 75926 will allow you remove the set
accessor from the interface while keeping the feature "changeable".

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 75926 ***

traces.message: The feature 'serverType' is not a valid changeable feature
